summary: This is an email chain from July 2020 regarding the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses the handling of subpoena returns from UBS bank, including file transfers, password sharing, and updating a subpoena tracker. The correspondence involves paralegals and authorized officers coordinating document management.

events.title: UBS Subpoena Returns Handling
events.description: Emails were exchanged regarding the receipt and processing of subpoena returns from UBS bank for the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. Files were password-protected and required unzipping before being saved to a shared drive and updating a subpoena tracker.

events.title: Confirmation of File Upload
events.description: A confirmation email was sent indicating that subpoena return files from UBS had been saved, updated on an index, and uploaded to USAfx for download as part of the SDNY investigation.

keyFacts: The document is part of the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, focusing on financial records from UBS bank.
Subpoena returns from UBS were received and processed in July 2020, indicating ongoing investigative activity after Epstein's death.
Files were password-protected with 'Max_0707' and required unzipping, suggesting sensitive financial data.
A 'subpoena tracker' and shared drive (Epstein shared) were used to manage document flow in the investigation.
The correspondence shows coordination between legal staff to handle evidence, including uploading files to USAfx for download.
